meanings.definition: The quality or state of being a laggard.
meanings.sent1: Her laggardness in completing tasks often caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent2: The laggardness of the tortoise compared to the hare was evident in the race.
meanings.sent3: Despite her laggardness, she always managed to finish her work before the deadline.
meanings.sent4: The laggardness of the snail was a reminder to enjoy the journey rather than rush through it.
meanings.sent5: His laggardness in responding to emails made him miss important opportunities.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being slow or delayed in progress or development.
meanings.sent1: The laggardness of the plant's growth surprised the gardener.
meanings.sent2: The team's laggardness in adapting to new technology hindered their success.
meanings.sent3: The laggardness of the sloth was both amusing and endearing to the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: The laggardness of the river's flow mirrored the slow pace of life in the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The laggardness of the internet connection frustrated the online gamers.
